alert.note: Alert for Meriwether; Pike (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 12:02AM EDT until March 29 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River below Big Branch near Molena affecting Pike and Meriwether Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senioa, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River below Big Branch near Molena. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 30.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 29.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.8 feet on 07/13/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
